title: Real Madrid vs Barcelona : El Clasico team news , TV channel and lineups | Football
body_text:
Two of the biggest clubs on the planet did not let us down on Sunday as Real Madrid edged Barcelona 2-1 in a brilliant game at the Santiago Bernabeu.
The superstars of the home side stepped forward as Kylian Mbappe and Jude Bellingham scored the goals for Xabi Alonso’s side, the Englishman setting up the Frenchman expertly for the first.
Those strikes came either side of a Fermin Lopez equaliser, brilliantly set up by Marcus Rashford from the left flank.
Real Madrid deserved the win, looking the more threatening side for most of the contest, despite Barcelona hanging onto plenty of possession.
The home team had a penalty decision overturned and three goals disallowed for offside, while Mbappe also saw a penalty brilliantly saved by Wojciech Szczęsny.
Pedri was sent off deep into stoppage time for a second bookable offence and things kicked off on the touchline between the two squads.
The win puts Real Madrid five points clear of Barca at the top of La Liga.

Live Feed
This Live Blog has now ended
This blog is now closed. For the latest updates, visit Metro’s Football page.
FULL-TIME: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
That’s it!
Drama to the end and Real Madrid claim a brilliant win over their old rivals.
90+10 mins: RED CARD – Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Pedri is off! A second yellow for the Barcelona midfielder for a fould on Tchouameni.
90+8 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Rodrygo sees a free-kick saved by Szczesny. Fermin Lopez is booked for a foul on Ceballos.
90+7 mins: SUBSTITUTION – Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Another chance for Barca very late on as Martin comes on for Balde.
90+6 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Having said that, Casado has a decent chance which is blocked.
90+5 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
It’s Real Madrid who are having the better opportunities late in the game. Rodrygo should do better but his shot easily saved.
90+2 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
We are into added time, of which there are NINE minutes.
90 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Real Madrid subs as Gonzalo and Ceballos on for Bellingham and Mbappe.
89 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
CHANCE! Kounde is on the end of a brilliant ball into the box from Yamal. He tries to take it on the chest but his touch is heavy and the goalkeeper grabs the ball.
88 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Mbappe still plugging away, speeds into the left hand side of the box and has a pop. Tricky angle and it goes wide of the far post.
84 mins: SUBSTITUTION – Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Bardghji on for Cubarsi for Barca
83 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Araujo fires a long range shot wide for Barcelona, who look to be getting a bit desperate here.
79 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Barcelona having a lot of the ball in Real Madrid’s half but struggling to cut through. The home side remain a threat on the break. Mbappe has an effort blocked after a rapid counter-attack.
74 mins: SUBSTITUIONS – Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Barca make changes as Raul Araujo and Marc Casado come of for Eric Garcia and Ferran Torres.
72 mins: SUBSTITUTIONS – Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Vinicius Jr cannot believe it as he is replaced by Rodrygo.
Valverde is now replaced by Carvajal.
71 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Rashford is on corner duties on the right and he finds Kounde but he nods over from the edge of the six-yard box.
68 mins: GOAL DISALLOWED – Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Yet another goal ruled out for Real Madrid. Bellingham scores this time but there was an offside in the build up.
67 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
The home team not resting on their laurels here. Vinicius curls one wide from the left. Bellingham fires in an effort from range shortly after, but it is blocked.
Barcelona obviously pushing but Real Madrid have not given up on attacking.
65 mins: Substitution: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Carvajal got ready but has been sent back to sit down as Valverde soldiers on.
Brahim Diaz comes on for Arda Guler.
64 mins: Real Madrid 2-1 Barcelona
Lamine Yamal smashes one into the stands from distance, which delights the home fans.
Valverde is down injured and looks set to be replaced by Carvajal.
